website_summaries.verdict: Though far from perfect, the Linksys E2500's ease of use, nice design, and reasonable price make it a very good router for a small home or apartment.
pros: The affordable true-dual-band Linksys E2500 Advanced Dual-Band N router is easy to use, thanks to the included Cisco Connect software and a well-organized Web interface
The router is also stylish and compact
cons: The Linksys E2500's range is short and its 2.4GHz-band performance is subpar
The included Cisco Connect utility provides limited access to the router's features, doesn't work in sync with the Web interface, and requires a live Internet connection to work

customer_reviews.title: Works but installation CD is useless
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to set up because it comes with an installer CD that is incompatible with the latest operating systems, and the Linksys website is a little out of date and circuitous in the instructions. You will need to use the admin pages to set up. The CD will unlikely work on the operating systems currently running today. However it does work, so if you need a router this will work. Just keep in mind that their intended installation process will probably not work for your computer. Currently running the latest firmware, so don't worry about upgrading.
customer_reviews.author: A. Walker

customer_reviews.title: The router works fine but it came with a CD-ROM
customer_reviews.text: The router works fine but it came with a CD-ROM... I repeat... a CD-ROM (in 2018). Fortunately my laptop has a CD drive but many new ones don't. What's even worse was that the installation software was NOT compatible with the latest MacBook update. It wasn't even compatible with the second oldest version. I had to call the company and perform a manual setup which took over an hour. Considering that Linksys is one of the leading router brands, I was shocked. The person who helped me on the phone was helpful but said that they simply just haven't updated their software yet. Seriously?!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Worst service EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with CD to set up but no weblink. Surly helpline guy insists on taking email and phone BEFORE he can direct me to website. Why? Simple question. Eventually find the download and it doesn't work. Call back and once more they insist on all the info for the marketing data base. FINALLY we get to setting up the item and the techie needs help (jesus - it's a CD OR a download OR....). We get to plugging it in and they drop the call. Linksys - you're off my list. If i could give you zero stars i would. #linksysuseless
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy A. McDowall

customer_reviews.title: Spend money on something better.
customer_reviews.text: I’ll make it quick. Confirming the range on this is very limited. One bar drops off about 30 feet from the router. Compared to my single band pos this is a lot worse. Setup is impossible for Mac users without an cd drive. The links to the software are outdated and the Mac software was not identifying the router. Had to use a PC to install and I’ve worked in IT before. Max throughput is 300mps which is fine. Overall. Spend the money on something better.
customer_reviews.author: LHSF

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: This router wasted my money. The E1000 worked for 9 years and is still good but could not handle the increased capacity. This E2500 was supposed to handle the increased capacity of two TVs, computers, cells phones and pads and allow for visitor streaming access. It work sometimes for some things but was always dropping accesses stating IP address not found. Only the two computers closes to it had the least connectivity issues.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda J Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Linksys E2500 Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router as a replacement for the same brand and model I had before, I expected this one to be an upgraded model with the same model number. Some came with an added USB port like the included picture, but when it was delivered it didn't have the upgrade either. If you buy this Linksys E2500 (N600) Advanced Simultaneous Dual-Band Wireless-N Router don't expect it to come with the USB Port.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Linksys E2500 Router Works For Me
customer_reviews.text: I had a Linksys WRT54G Wireless Router in service here at home for the last six years. It works well, but I decided it was time to move up to a more modern router. After researching the various models available, I settled on the Linksys E2500 Dual-Band Wireless-N Router. Connecting it was easy, using the instructions provided, on screen, from the included CD from Linsys. It started working immediately and connected, wirelessly, with my desk-top computer, printer, tablets (2) and my smartphone. The wi-fi signal is sufficient throughout the house (both floors). It's been in service for three weeks and I'm satisfied with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle reader from NY

customer_reviews.title: this was a nice surprise! It provides WPA2  automatically
customer_reviews.text: This router (Linksys E2500 (N600)) has replaced my 8 year old Linksys router, and it's been working very well. I wasn't able to use the setup on the enclosed DVD - it gave me an error message, but I managed to set it up through the Control Panel within a few minutes. Compared to the horrors of connecting my previous routers, this was a nice surprise! It provides [edited: my review said WEP originally, but it is an fact WPA2, please see comments] automatically, so no need to do any separate setup for securing the network. We have about 10 wireless devices on the network, including video stream, and can see the difference in the overall speed. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: b2992

customer_reviews.title: Pleased to have purchased it!
customer_reviews.text: This was a direct replacement for the one I purchased several years ago and lost due to a "zap." Installation was smooth and the unit was up and running in no time. Performance has been just as it should be.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Drops signal.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan of this router at all. I returned it and went with an Asus RT-N53. This router took a while to set up, the web browser interface is slow. Linksys pretty much won't give you any support unless you install it using their CD. Unfortunately, the software wasn't compatible with the latest version of OS X Maverick. This router kept dropping the wifi signal. I did try to adjust the settings to fix the issue. In the end I decided it wasn't worth the hassle and after consulting the Linksys support boards this seems to be a common problem. There are much better products out there for less money then this router.
customer_reviews.author: Hodzy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. Once I got it set up and running the 5ghz channel disappeared only to come back every once in awhile. the 2.4 ghz would fluctuate signal strength and eventually drop you out completely. Tech support was more interested in mining me for personal information than in making their router work. I finally had to hang up on the lady. I have used Linksys routers for years, in-fact I am still using the "g" router I wanted to upgrade. I wont be upgrading with Linksys again. Time to shop around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: My previous wireless routers have all been Linksys models and I have had no complaints. After several years, my wireless G router started to be unreliable and cease transmitting intermittently. I purposefully searched only for the Cisco/Linksys routers for a new wireless N model. There was a model which seemed to fulfill my needs, but I continued with my due diligence. I came across a feature comparison chart of all Lynksys models and decided upon the next better model which had dual bands. The chart was a great aid in making my choice and I am not disappointed in the least.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only Con is the Set Up . . .
customer_reviews.text: Great router, fast streams and no problems once you configurate, the only con is the set up, I've even had to call Linksys support because it won't did the auto setup with the software provided. It seems the firmware was outdated so it needed the new one and then a manual configuration. Hopefully, once i did that, it worked without issues, the lady who helped me trough the process in the telephone support asistence was very patient, gentle and responsive to all my doubts. Recomended for anyone who need a not so expensive solution for a wireless network, it's fast, i use it primarily for gaming and with my smartphone and works very good.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Moreira

customer_reviews.title: Setup is VERY EASY. Insert the Linksys disk into a wired or ...
customer_reviews.text: Setup is VERY EASY. Insert the Linksys disk into a wired or wireless laptop or computer and run thru the setup establishing a name for the router and a password. After the initial setup I had issues with my Amazon Fire Stick connecting to the router. I had to run the install a second time using the SAME router name and password I established the first time. AFTER THE 2ND INSTALLATION... ALL IS GOOD!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Have had this router for about a month now. It works great. I use a IMac computer and in part selected this router because it was advertised as easy to set up with a Mac. The Cisco Mac set up program is excellent. With in ten minutes it was operating. Many times the wizard type programs will only support a PC and with a Mac it must be manually installed. Not so with this router and Cisco Mac install program. I strongly recommend this router. Concerning it's performance, I had no problem connecting to my new internet radio which is located on the other side of my house. Very pleased with my router selection and purchase thru Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: W. Torg

customer_reviews.title: wouldn't connect to LAN!!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly poor installation and support. I should have known that when it didn't find the PC I was installing from, it wasn't going to work. Installed from laptop, and worked OK, but still wouldn't connect to desktop. Wasted over an hour w/Linksys support. Disconnected and put old router back on, and up in running in 2 minutes. Do not buy this router for any wired networks! Additional comment: Amazon was great however, issued credit within 2 days of return. Shipped Netgear router 1 day ahead of schedule. Glad I went through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: mardy

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, great performance
customer_reviews.text: This was a snap to set up. Literally, wireless connections were done in seconds, not minutes. There is a GUI front end that Cisco/Linksys has added to the original web-based access to the set up and configuration settings. It does simplify the most commonly used features. I have had Netflix lose movies mid-way through or had some latency and the associated Netflix "Retrieving" message with progress bar but I cannot say with certainty that it is a result of the router since I was getting this with my old router also. I'm happy. Security is easily set up also. For the money, I don't think you can do better, particularly for dual-band.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Krause

customer_reviews.title: Super affordable product that does what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: Super affordable product that does what it's supposed to do. I moved to an apartment 2 months ago and the cable company said I had to provide my own router for my wireless, or I could buy theirs for $90. So of course I turned to Amazon and found this gem. My 19yo was at the home when the cable was installed so I had to link everything myself when I got home. It was so simple to do and I haven't had a hiccup since.
customer_reviews.author: Kat 440

customer_reviews.title: Mac 10.9 owners beware
customer_reviews.text: Mac 10.9 owners beware the Linksys Connect software you need to configure this device does not yet run on 10.9. It works fine on 10.8 and below (and on Windows). I contacted Linksys support (now part of Belkin) and the lady (presumably in India) said they don't have a version for 10.9. I bought two of these a while back when I was still on 10.8 and they installed OK and work very well. But if you are on 10.9 don't buy one until Linksys has upgraded their software.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is the best router I've owned. The thing works great, I had no trouble setting it up, I have laptop, phone, tablet, and desktop all routed through it with no issues, no lag, no problems of any kind. It easily works all over my apartment with no dead spots (then again, I have a fairly small place, but still, no problems). This thing can interfere with wireless mice if it is in close proximity. I had to get a corded mouse for my desktop because of it. Wireless mice work fine on the other side of the room, but they don't seem to like sharing the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Linksys are reliable routers
customer_reviews.text: The most important thing to remember when picking a router is how does it fit your needs? In my case I needed a good midrange router that can handle connections for a few items. This router not only met those needs but also provided me with some room for growth. I also like the fact that it is dual band which allows me to separate the video streaming connection from the others. In this was a good buy and I would recommend Linksys to others.
customer_reviews.author: leonard r Cruz

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Router in April of 2013 and was researching some of the best budget routers I could find. I live in a 700 Square Foot apartment and this thing works great. The signal never drops and I've never had any issues with it. My father also has one in his 3 bedroom home and it has also been perfectly reliable for him. Like I said before, I've had it for about 7 months and I would not hesitate to buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Filzen

customer_reviews.title: Very easy setup
customer_reviews.text: This is my first purchase of a Linksys router and was very impressed with the setup to my laptop and desktop computers. I love it. I chose Linksys based upon website reviews of product. I'm very pleased with purchase and would recommend. I purchased a Belkin router many years ago and it was a nightmare. Finally just disconnected and put in a closet. Products have much improved since my first experience. I'm very happy I chose Linksys!
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: Good Product; Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Valet router which I had for several years. Because I had had my Valet for so long, I went with another Linksys product. I am not disappointed: it was easy to set up and works fine. I am technologically knowledgeable, but I am not a true tech geek. I also don't do any gaming, so the speed is fine by my standards. I do, however, do a lot of "retail therapy," and pages load quite efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Rosebud

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one that I have bought. My first one I had for years and then it got zapped by and electricity storm surge. So I bought the exact same one because the old one last me a very long time and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Linksys E2500 router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace my aging Westell router. I had great expectations from this unit as the specs state. After having it for 1 wee it started loosing signals. It would just drop the wiifi connections. Contacted Amazon and they sent email to Butterfly Photo. I have not heard thing from Amazon or from the seller. This might be a good router when purchasing a new unit but please don't buy this as a refurbished unit especially from Butterfly photo. Waste of time and money. I have moved on to another router which is working excellent.
customer_reviews.author: zia khawaja

customer_reviews.title: A nice router.  Good price
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup for non-technical users. Advanced features are very limited through the UI however.
customer_reviews.author: GLK2

customer_reviews.title: Router is fine, but was sent old stock
customer_reviews.text: I was sent old stock -- version 1 software though version 2 is available. As a result, I couldn't install it with the installation disk as it wanted me to update my software but the problem was my software was too new for the disk. I ended up spending more than 5 hours on the phone over two nights with three different Linksys reps -- two of whom were competent -- to get the appropriate settings so that it would work. It was a totally frustrating experience that shouldn't have happened.
customer_reviews.author: JKR

customer_reviews.title: Non functioning out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box the power adapter didn't work. Luckily had my old Linksys power adapter which had same volt/amp and got power to router, unfortunately after 90 minutes of technical support i was told to return the product. Person who helped me was nice, and easy to understand, but obviously had a script that didn't work well with the E2500. This was the 8th Linksys router I've bought, and the 2nd router in a row I've received that was broken upon receipt. Not sure what I'll buy next, want a router that works!!!
customer_reviews.author: Erich

customer_reviews.title: Linksys E2500 Advanced Router
customer_reviews.text: Finally, something I could install without having to call my brother-in-law for help. The Cisco installation disk tells you what to do, and actually sets the router up so that you just have to follow the directions and away you go. We just purchased a HP Computer with Windows 8 and the Tower built in the Monitor (amazing), and we wanted a more advanced Router that would also accommodate the Smart phones. It is absolutely what we needed, and this has solved the problem of off-line messages popping up and I can now keep a connection on my smartphone to our home Wi-Fi. Very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cb

customer_reviews.title: Limited
customer_reviews.text: Does not get the whole house. My house is 2,500 sq feet and the signal does not cover whole house.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Roach

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: After seeing reviews of Netgear and Linksys I decided that this unit would suffice to connect my Samsung TV to Netflix. (I'm glad I didn't spend the additional $50 for the E3200). I got it connected today, quick and easy with the included software. The speed is amazing! Couldn't be happier. Amazon wouldn't ship it here so I went with Circuit City and paid the $12 for two day UPS. That was great also. I ordered it on Sat, 23rd and got it yesterday. I did not receive any emails from CC but when I called them I got the shipping and tracking info.
customer_reviews.author: James Dooman

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This router works. That's why I like it. Easy to set up and use. Just make sure that you start your modem and that the modem is up and running (by up and running I mean that all of the lights are on showing that there is power, it is sending and receiving, and it is online) before you plug the router into the modem, otherwise the router will connect to your computer, but it won't be connected to the internet. Once connected properly, it works like a charm. The tests I have done have shown that it is just as fast as the wired connection. I've been pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jegan

customer_reviews.title: Good router but could be a little better
customer_reviews.text: This router has been working for several months now. It has decent range though it could be just a little better. I've had to use another wireless router as an access point to extend the range so there's 5 bars no matter what room in the house I'm in. Another thing this router could have used is a data use log to see how much data is being used, especially useful for ISPs which have limited data and charge large overage fees.
customer_reviews.author: SoulsSong

customer_reviews.title: Love the Guest Login Feature
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend too much $ since technology changes so fast. I bought this to replace my 3 year old Linksys WRT120. I frequently got disconnected and it rarely stayed connected to my new smartphone. This was a breeze to install with the CD that came with. No more disconnects, no more dead zones in my house, no more messages of "buffering" when streaming on my Roku box AND an option for Guest login without access to my personal info.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: I used to be a belkin man. First router I owned was a belkin G. Worked great. So when it came time for an upgrade, I bought a Belkin N router. Worked good for about 2 weeks and then crap. Called Belkin, they did little to help. Lived with it disconnecting me from the internet constantly for far to long. A friend of mine had the Linksys 2000 recommend that I get an E2500. It has worked flawless for me. I am very happy with the purchase. No more being disconnected from the internet at some random time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Trentham

customer_reviews.title: Save money on your cable bill by not renting your router.
customer_reviews.text: Was able to install it with the help line that they provided since I didn't have a slot for the CD. It was suggested to be the same as the router that I was renting from my cable company. Wanted to save money on the cable bill. Seems to be working fine. Has a one year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: Set-up was easy enough but limited for advanced users. Not as good of a range as my WRT-310N gigabyte router. Maybe a little faster after as much tweaking as I felt comfortable doing. Thought it would improve my media streaming but hasn't...think its actually the blu-ray player, but gonna replace that as well. Only had it for 2 weeks and have already ordered the ASUS RT-N66U Dual-Band Wireless-N900 Gigabit Router to replace it. Hope to add the E2500 as a bridge or expander to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey W. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good for basic use
customer_reviews.text: Good size, easy to install , good signal if at a small space.
customer_reviews.author: GPolanco

customer_reviews.title: Less than 20 minutes to unpack,set up and run.
customer_reviews.text: The manufactures must have made some major improvements since the last time I tried to setup a router in my home. I could not get the last one I bought 3 year ago to work, so I gave it to my daughter. I eventually had to get a router for our smart phones. This one was easy to get up and running. I could not be happier. The range is about 50 or so feet. So I can still be connected when I am outside the house. If you want an easy to set up router this one will work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Signal weaker than Motorola SBG658
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this wireless router to be replaced with my Motorola cable modem built-in WiFi () but I got disappointed because its WiFi signal was even worse than the Motorola itself. If you see the Motorola modem reviews, you'll find lots of complains about the weak wireless signal. I should tell you that this one has even weaker signal with lower speed. So, I returned it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: After some issues understanding wireless networks, I finally was able to set up this router and establish a home network. Even with a wireles printer. This router is easy to understand and set up with parental controls and much more than I will ever understand. Basically, if you have a CAT 5 type cable, you can set up a wireless network. This does not work with a wifi hotspot like sold through Verizon or other carriers. You must have an actual wired cable to plug in.
customer_reviews.author: LollyAnne

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money to buy a little better router.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 other routers before this one and all of them are sitting in a drawer because of range issues or needing to be reset. I bought this set it up and haven't had an Internet issue since I bought it ( probably about a year now). Definitely worth the money to buy a little better router.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Helmer

customer_reviews.title: Did not last.
customer_reviews.text: This router was excellent while it worked. Less than 20 months after purchase, the wifi stopped working. Out of warranty, I'm left to buy another. Suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: The Reverend Mother

customer_reviews.title: perfect for the job
customer_reviews.text: I use this router to piggy back to a juniper ssg5. It does a perfect job. It took 5 minutes to set up. My connection is solid and stable. The zone control ability is there with the mini firewall and application control. I use my Juniper for that. The guest wireless feature works great. I can let friends have access to my network without giving away the keys to the castle, so to speak. All in all I definately would recommend this router to anyone with more than basic connectivity needs.
customer_reviews.author: CThomas

customer_reviews.title: Basic Router
customer_reviews.text: I got this router for its ability to be configured to a fine level. I don't use the wireless portion of the router, it can be turned off in the settings, so I can't comment on the wireless abilities one way or the other. If you are familiar with the older Linksys routers, the interface will seem familiar to you. It is easy to navigate, and has many options to configure your network the way you want. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: not impressed coming from E-1000
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my linksys e1000, after reading reviews I thought this would be a huge difference in the internet speed, my old router kept losing its connection, so far this one has not, but there is not a noticeable difference in the speed either. There is a whole new router system coming out that uses a different wave that promises to be much faster, i would wait until it is released or get something else.
customer_reviews.author: JasonReviews

customer_reviews.title: Working great... for our Apartment
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my new apartment, with a brand new Motorola modem and Time Warner Cable Extreme Internet (30mbps DL / 5mbps UL). The router seems to be working just fine. I did a speed test before writing this review and I got 24.85mbps DL and 5.35mbps UL over my Wireless signal. That's perfect for the 2 of us. The signal covers our entire apartment and we haven't had one slow down yet.
customer_reviews.author: Brad the Tech Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router.
customer_reviews.text: We were having connectivity issues with our router at wrk which can prove to be extremely frustrating and inefficient. What is great about this item aside from the speed is that it allows access for authorized personnel; so our work PC, smart phones, and tablets, and allows a max of ten visitors which is great because our old router would slow when guests were using our internet. I love this product because it has made our jobs so much easier and it has improved our business. I would recommend to any small business owner.
customer_reviews.author: Mykha'él

customer_reviews.title: nice brick
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these running ... two of them worked for 6 months, then they turned into a brick ... they come up ...if at all ...with a "Management Console" screen ... the firmware offered on their website does not install..... support is useless.. .. there are plenty of people who have the same problem .... check the web.
customer_reviews.author: d arivas

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Very good Wi Fi router. I get good coverage of Wi Fi throughout my house. I have a 50 MBPS connection. Product was delivered in a nice packing. Had a CD for installation. Easy to install. It has guest access feature and you can easily set the password and add devices. I am happy with the product. I have never faced any speed issues with the Wi Fi and it works smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: SN

customer_reviews.title: Slower Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I have a cheap D-Link router and needed a second router. I purchased this Linksys router for over twice the price of the D-Link hoping to have even higher speeds and better connectivity with longer range. After getting this, I ran some tests on it, excited to be impressed with my new purchase. What I found is that the D-Link router would give me wireless download speeds of over 35 Mb while the Linksys I just purchased would deliver just over 16 Mbps. Less than half the speed of the cheaper router I purchased years ago. Upside – Longer Range Downside – Slower speeds
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Strothmann

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, good range
customer_reviews.text: Excellent high-speed router. Allows both bands to work simultaneously (many dual-frequency routers do not) to increase speed. Much better than the FIOS router that Verizon gives you. Decent range--I can often connect from my car 100 feet from my house.
customer_reviews.author: K. Nagelberg

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after two years of use. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: M. Howell

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Used the web interface to assign an IP on my network. I needed a secondary wireless access point and this router gave me that. It’s in Bridge Mode so, DHCP is handled by my main router (Linksys E3500). Good price too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do your research if you need a good guest network
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely atrocious guest network capabilities. Do your research if you need a good guest network. Otherwise it's a decent router with good range. I have a pair of these wired into my network providing wireless across 25,000 square feet (mostly open shop space).
customer_reviews.author: Dana S.

customer_reviews.title: 100% reliable to about 20 ft
customer_reviews.text: So far it's been 100% reliable. Have had for about 8 months. I bought another one for family and both were difficult to set up. Had to call tech support both times because I use Hughsnet. Main issue is you only get about a 20 ft range. Then the connection starts to slow considerably. I live in a stick built home with two levels approx 1200 square ft. Connection is almost unusable on the lower level.
customer_reviews.author: Pollysnap

customer_reviews.title: Signal isn’t that great
customer_reviews.text: I replace an older router (10 years old) with this one and got less coverage
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent router but good value for price
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a good router for the price paid but I have to give it 3 stars due to the somewhat spotty coverage in the house while upstairs, and the speed can sometimes be slow as well. It does come with password encytion and the option to set up a guest network that doesn't require a password.
customer_reviews.author: Bwest

customer_reviews.title: Linksys manged to break the wifi on a wireless router
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this hoping to use the wireless part of this WIRELESS ROUTER, don't waste your money. Only the guest wifi works and ti only works for certain things, laptops. Forget trying to use this for android or apple phones or even wireless printers because they managed to break the wireless on their wireless router. Customer support was also a joke, their support was either update the firmware or full reset the router and preform set up again. Both which do nothing, what a joke of wireless router that doesn't even let you use the wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Annabelle

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 8 months - epic fail
customer_reviews.text: Lets see, I bought it in August of 2014 and this is April of 2015 and needless to say it stopped working. Currently I am connected directly to my modem for the internet until I can buy a different product. Of course I can't send it back, because it is past the October cutoff. Lesson learned. buy from a retailer that stands behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: JCTUSA

customer_reviews.title: Has dual band connection
customer_reviews.text: I use this device to connect other devices that only operate on 2.4 GHz while other devices I prefer to utilize 5 GHz.
customer_reviews.author: Rolaid

customer_reviews.title: Linksys E2500 Advanced Simultaneous Dual-Band Wireless-N Router
customer_reviews.text: This item was delivered on time and in excellent shape. Within 45 minutes or so I had it installed and operating. The set up is simple and easy and thus can be done by just about anyone. It immediately starting working the minute I finished the installation and then setting up my laptop and cell phone were equally easy. Everything about this router is improved from my past routers and in my opinion it is a solid performer.
customer_reviews.author: Flyboy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This router is perfect for my needs, and it covers a medium-sized house with a very strong signal, even through 3 walls. It was easy to set up, and I've not had a single issue after a few months of ownership, and I have about 10 devices on it. There's a guest account option too. The only thing I miss are the lights on the front, but it hasn't been an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Recently replaced my 7/8 year old linksys with a new ...
customer_reviews.text: Recently replaced my 7/8 year old linksys with a new belkin and had problems from the start. I was unable to reset the belkin to factory defaults, was unable to connect devices. After a week or 2 of issues I went and ordered a new linksys and returned the belkin. Been smooth sailing ever since, super-easy set up, and very user friendly. I'm a linksys girl for life now!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk bricked after two hours
customer_reviews.text: Complete piece of junk. Like an abused spouse I keep coming back to linksys products only to be let down again and again. They consistently fail, degrade, and are just horribly engineered hardware. Buy a D-Link. Buy a Netgear, but don't buy another linksys product. Its a crap shoot, and in the best case it just wears out in a short period of time...
customer_reviews.author: Christian Friedland

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in November and by the following August it was done! Don't have the box but figure it would have at least a 1 year warranty. Don't know who to contact for support or warranty. Very disappointed in the quality. Would like a refund or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: MBailey

customer_reviews.title: The seller sent it super quick, so I was able to set it ...
customer_reviews.text: The seller sent it super quick, so I was able to set it up just in time for what I needed. The set up process is super quick and easy. There i only one downfall: the set up program is not compatible with my Mac computer because I have too new of a system. It didm;t really matter for me because I just booted it up on my Windows 8.1 partition and it worked perfect. It is fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Krys

customer_reviews.title: I Got A Good One
customer_reviews.text: Got well over a year on this one with daily use and still going on without a hiccup.... which is rare for these things. I realize these things are luck of the draw with any of them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert The Consumer

customer_reviews.title: ... router for my new High Speed DSL I've had great experience with Lynksys in the past but this one ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router for my new High Speed DSL I've had great experience with Lynksys in the past but this one didn't work for me. The professional installer couldn't get it to work with my system I think I needed a router capable of handling 150-plus Mbps. I am sure this is a good product but it didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: 4Crynoutloud

customer_reviews.title: This unit works well, but I had a little ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit works well, but I had a little trouble setting it up because the disk that came with it wasn't applicable to my internet provider. I had to set it up using the tech support from my provider instead of using the disk.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Anna

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately when I receive this product it was a book inside the router box
customer_reviews.author: Blair Crozier

customer_reviews.title: this is a terrific item and simple to install (complete with 'how to' ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a terrific item and simple to install (complete with 'how to' video. Delivery was also 2 days earlier than listed. Since I had Linksys before, all I had to do was change name and password to my old one and all my other devices clicked on with reinstalling.
customer_reviews.author: JC Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded an older Linksys router since my bandwidth was constantly fluctuating between 20MB/sec and 2MB/sec. I was having to constantly to reset the router. This was easy to set up and the rate states consistent. My only advice is don't use the install software provided, and just stick with the web-based user interface. No reason to slow your system down with unnecessary software.
customer_reviews.author: Marc B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router for small network
customer_reviews.text: This router does a good job for small business or home network. It handles very well the problem being in a crowded area with a number of other networks in the area. My old router was having trouble with interference which was causing decreased speed and some errors. No longer is a problem with this router. I recommend this system home and small business usage.
customer_reviews.author: pskofield

customer_reviews.title: Great Tomato Router
customer_reviews.text: Good Little Router for the money. Installed Tomato Firmware for VPN use. 5.0Ghz band stopped working after a few days but the 2.4 is reliable and it handles VPN traffic and Router Level Ad Blocking Scripts great. Would have given 5 stars if the 5Ghz Radio hadn't stopped working almost immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Powers

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: This was fine for as long as it lasted. We noticed issues when my husband and I were both streaming but my big complaint is that I got this in November and it is already dead. So, a little over six months it lasted. Not worth it if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: SBM

customer_reviews.title: Great router for the $
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my E1200 that kept crashing. I didn't need gigabit wired LAN but did want dual band wireless due to wireless congestion in my neighborhood. This router does the trick! No issues with 2.4 or 5ghz signal. Running in N-only mode since I don't have any legacy G devices. I'm very pleased with this router.
customer_reviews.author: riddler

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable router
customer_reviews.text: This router works great. I've never had any issues with it and I've been using it for over three years now. I don't even normally think about it since it's so reliable, so I don't have much else to say. If only Comcast was as reliable as this router, my internet would always be fast and working.
customer_reviews.author: Leanna

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Router!
customer_reviews.text: This router has every feature I could ever want and provides great thoughput. The setup and connection to devices could not be easier! When I hooked it up and started the install there was a software upgrade needed and it connected to the Internet, downloaded and installed completely automatically. I have 2 desktops, 3 laptops and a wireless connect point for my main HDTV and connecting to them was simply following the instructions on my computer screen.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Veal

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: My old router kept having connection issues, and it was OLD. I figured it was time to try the newer N technology, especially since I now have about a dozen wi-fi devices in various parts of the house. The E-2500 was extremely easy to set up and has worked flawlessly for the last 90+ days. The price was competitive, delivery fast, and it does what I want it to do. (See again this review title.)
customer_reviews.author: TXDukeOfEarle

customer_reviews.title: Great, simple router
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this router for years and have never had a problem with it. I set it up once and never had to do anything to it again. I don't experience "blind spots", I have wifi throughout my whole 1000 sq ft house, if that is a concern for some people. Great router.
customer_reviews.author: Love Joy

customer_reviews.title: I see why Cisco sold the Linksys product line
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because of the Cisco name and the features but I have been very disappointed. First, after spending more than 4 hours with Linksys technical support - they could not determine why I was only getting 1-2 MB/s with a cable connection that would get 25 MB/s wired. So they sent out a replacement (looked refurbished). Now, 3 months later the speed went from a respectable 10 MB/s down to 1-2 MB/sec again. Yes, it has good features. Yes, it has easy setup. But it doesn't stay fully up and it requires alot of time. Maybe Belkin will do a better job than Cisco.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Clancy

customer_reviews.title: Solid but weak
customer_reviews.text: The router does what it's supposed to, albeit the signal is too weak to generate high speed waves for very far or long. As advertised, it is for a smaller space, say about 1600 sq. ft. But the price was right and the stronger devices are just too expensive for routers. Best surprise is that Cisco customer support is very good. The best I've dealt with in this field and much more knowledgable and responsive than their competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Negative experience
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the refurbished E2500 Cisco router and experienced problems trying to install it. There were many calls to Cisco for tech help and the corrections were very temporary. I talked to several techs and the final call was when I could not get the desktop to recieve the internet signal. Within a very short time the tech had me do some procedures that shut down the internet to all computers and tvs. He stated it was a computer problem and hung up. I then called Charter, my internet service provider and subscribed to their modem/router service. Upon installing the equipment all is working fine now. I returning the router for a refund. Bob Norton
customer_reviews.author: Bob Norton

customer_reviews.title: Will not work in Japan worth a crap!
customer_reviews.text: Pure Junk!!! Will not work in Japan worth a crap!
customer_reviews.author: North Japan

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very pleased with the quality and speed of this router. I do not notice anything amazing because it is dual band, but that is probably because Brighthouse cable is not the speediest provider of internet. It does do what it is supposed to do, which is get me connected to the network
customer_reviews.author: Chris Smith

customer_reviews.title: A Special Thank You.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as my router was giving problems. It came the next day after buying it from Amazon. When problems occur Cisco airport segregating and helpful with me. We spent 6 to7 hours in a chat session. I ended it. My Wi-Fi is now working. It has been at least a month. Thank you to Cisco and Amazon airport teams. They are the best. Betty
customer_reviews.author: Betty Louise

customer_reviews.title: Buy this router!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one after returning the ASUS RT-N10P (see my review). This router was the difference between day and night. Very easy set up, connected all 4 computers, wireless printer, a Kindle, 2 Ipods. and a ROKU. Works wonderfully! Have not been dropped once and internet speeds are up to where they should be.
customer_reviews.author: M. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Hard to set up and low bandwidth
customer_reviews.text: I had to have a friend who had linksys before help me set this up. Having a computer that didn't have CD-ROM made it nearly impossible to figure out what I actually needed to do to get this to work. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: jason ruetten

customer_reviews.title: It's not as good as the old LinkSys, but it's pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly how I need it to, and it was a breeze to install. I consider myself quite computer savvy, so I didn't expect a difficult set-up, but it really went smoothly. I have a house with three WAPs and this one just fit right in and replaced the one that failed. It came up on the network and linked everything together.
customer_reviews.author: Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied with  Linksys E2500 Router
customer_reviews.text: The Linksys E2500 router was very easy to install. The CD instructions were clear and easy to follow. I needed four LAN router ports for my computers as well as a source of Wi-fi signal for my laptops and other portable devices. The router allowed all these to function well and at a reasonable speed. Particularly for non techies, I highly recommend the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Daedelus

customer_reviews.title: Ok router, good buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: Was a good router, used it for a bit to replace a dlink. Eventually replaced this with an ea3500 which has provided a more solid connection, and I believe its faster for all of the devices connected here at any given moment.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: This is an upgrade from an old version Linksys model. I must say this new one I just ordered has lived up to its claim of fast internet connection. Since I installed this new version my gaming, and video streaming services has improved significantly. Downloading videos, and games now comes a lot faster, and easier. I would very much recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: James Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Working fine
customer_reviews.text: Set it up in my basement as the main router hanging off the modem. I still get a good signal up in my attic - on the third floor. I'm happy. Edit - about 5 months later. Not working fine at all. Can't keep it running for more than 10 minutes at a time. Just ordered a new one and going to swap it. Hopefully it will work well and for a decent amount of time. Probably get Amex to refund the cost of the first one, since it's too late to return to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Tedd

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well.  Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. Perfect for my needs. However, I must say that I do have one of the slowest internet speeds provided by my internet service. I just don't like having to pay $50 a month for internet so i got a cheaper, slower plan. This router does work well though. Works good for my ipad, iphone and my son's game system.
customer_reviews.author: Matt_P

customer_reviews.title: Very good product overall.
customer_reviews.text: The product is great but lacks connectivity issues as if it wants to connect when it wants and do what it pleases
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product quit working just under 90 days
customer_reviews.text: Called for tech support, they were unable to fix the Router. I had tried the firmware updates already to no avail. Offered to replace it for free, but could not do it directly with tech support. Must work through another customer service dept. I have been on two customer service lines for over 2 hours, so far no resolution. You may want to avoid and work with a company that can provide a product that works for more than 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: A Concerned Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Router works great, however, if you have any problems hooking it up, you're screwed. HINT: Unplug everything (modem as well as router) for the proverbial 10 seconds and try again, it works wonders No telephone support, so, you have to undo EVERYTHING to go on line for help. There is NO written instruction manual, just a CD, which gives you a link to a website that does you absolutely NO GOOD. A lot of frustration setting it up, but good once you have it set up. Take my hint above and save yourself a ton of frustration..
customer_reviews.author: Eli Manning

customer_reviews.title: Easy to do
customer_reviews.text: The Linksys is small and compact. It is incredibly easy to set up, and best of all, it has guest WiFi so your personal information is kept safe. I would recommend this device to anyone who needs to upgrade their WiFi network.
customer_reviews.author: Cattrina

product_meta.title: Linksys E2500 (N600) Advanced Simultaneous Dual-Band Wireless-N Router
product_meta.description:
The Linksys E2500 offers superior wireless speed (up to 300 + 300 Mbps), optimal range, and powerful dual band technology to provide advanced performance for active wireless households. Simultaneous dual band (2.4 + 5 GHz) technology doubles your network bandwidth and helps avoid network interference, enabling smoother and faster media streaming and file transfers. A MIMO antenna array offers superior range and reliability. And WPA/WPA2 encryption and SPI firewall help keep your network protected. Plus, included Cisco Connect software gets you set up in three easy steps and offers powerful tools for ongoing management of your network.

AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER



Linksys E2500
Dual-Band Wireless-N600 Router




CREATE A POWERFUL HOME WIRELESS NETWORK WITH DOUBLE THE CAPACITY FOR SURFING THE INTERNET, STREAMING MULTIMEDIA, AND RUNNING APPLICATIONS SIMULTANEOUSLY.
ADVANCED PERFORMANCE FOR ACTIVE ONLINE HOUSEHOLDS AND HOME OFFICES.
IDEAL FOR:


Easy set-up with Cisco Connect software

 * Larger households and home offices 
 * Surfing the Web, emailing and printing wirelessly 
 * Connecting multiple devices 
 * Transferring and downloading large files 
 * Streaming multimedia and gaming 



KEY FEATURES
 * High speed (up to 300 + 300 Mbps) for fast wireless transfer rates 
 * Extended range with MIMO antenna array 
 * Fast Ethernet (10/100 Mbps) ports to connect wired devices to the network 
 * Simultaneous dual-band to maximize throughput and help avoid network interference 








COMPARE ALL OF THE LINKSYS WI-FI ROUTERS BELOW AND CHOOSE THE ONE THAT'S RIGHT FOR YOUR HOME.






THE CISCO ADVANTAGE


CUTTING-EDGE TECHNOLOGY FROM THE NETWORKING LEADER
BEST-IN-CLASS SECURITY


24/7 AWARD-WINNING CUSTOMER SUPPORT
ONE-YEAR HARDWARE LIMITED WARRANTY








TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS


MINIMUM SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
 * PC: Wi-Fi enabled PC with CD or DVD drive, running Windows XP SP3, Windows Vista SP1 or later, Windows Vista SP1, or Windows 7
 * Mac: Wi-Fi enabled Mac with CD or DVD drive, running OS X Leopard 10.5 or later, Snow Leopard 10.6 or later, or Lion 10.7 or later
 * Web Browser: Internet Explorer 7, Safari 4, Firefox 3 or Chrome


PACKAGE CONTENTS
 * Linksys E2500 Advanced Dual-Band N Router
 * CD-ROM with Setup Software and Resources
 * Ethernet Cable
 * Power Adapter












See more
feature_bullets: Enjoy the power of simultaneous dual band Wireless N (802.11n) technology with double the capacity for surfing the web
Connect your computers, wireless printers, smartphones, and other wireless devices at up to 300 + 300 Mbps of transfer speed
Double your network bandwidth with simultaneous dual bands (2.4 GHz and 5 GHz) to help avoid interference
Enjoy the superior range provided by a MIMO antenna array
Use 4 Fast Ethernet (10/100 Mbps) ports to directly connect wired devices
Give visitors password protected Internet access on a separate network so your visitors have access to the Internet
Keep your network protected with customizable security settings, including WPA/WPA2 Personal and SPI firewall protection
Set up your wireless network in 3 easy steps using included Cisco Connect software

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,279 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
